thread.title: Rupert Murdoch, Kerry Stokes, Andy Penn arrive to hear AFL announce $2b broadcast deal
thread.title_full: Rupert Murdoch, Kerry Stokes, Andy Penn arrive to hear AFL announce $2b broadcast deal

author: Max Mason and John Stensholt
title: Rupert Murdoch, Kerry Stokes, Andy Penn arrive to hear AFL announce $2b broadcast deal
text:
Seven West Media and Foxtel are predicted to retain the broadcast rights. Photo: Getty Images
News Corp executive chairman Rupert Murdoch, Telstra chief executive Andy Penn and Seven West Media chairman Kerry Stokes will join AFL chief executive Gillon McLachlan and chairman Mike Fitzpatrick on Tuesday afternoon to announce a new, $2 billion-plus broadcast rights deal.
A press conference will be held at 4:30pm at AFL headquarters in Melbourne.
Fairfax Media's Street Talk column reported that Telstra was poised to retain the digital streaming rights for the AFL , while Seven West Media and Foxtel will retain the broadcast rights.
It comes just over a week after Nine Entertainment Co agreed to pay $925 million over five years to retain free-to-air broadcast rights to the National Rugby League , double the amount it is currently paying, from 2018.
Nine, in the new deal, will broadcast four live NRL games weekly, up from three, and also obtained the free digital streaming rights. The NRL is still in negotiations for pay-television, simulcast and international rights.
